The stage was now set for the escalation of provocations leading up to a conflagration designed to demonstrate mass anger on both sides. The natural anger of the Chinese people at yet another new gunboat invasion by yet another foreign power on the one hand and the staged religious persecutions on the other would create a firestorm in both the Japanese and Chinese press to kindle war fever in the people of both nations. That illusion was a perfect trap for the Chinese people and the government in Nanking to fall into.
